title: Hard Times for ETH Holders: Whales’ Unrealized Profit Ratio Shrinks to Bear Market Levels
body: Ethereum continues to face tough times in this bull cycle, underperforming other alternative coins despite its position as the second-largest cryptocurrency. While the broader crypto market is struggling currently, ether (ETH) appears to be getting hit the hardest compared to its rivals, as seen in the asset’s on-chain metrics. The latest data analyzed by the market intelligence platform CryptoQuant has found that the profit levels for ETH holders have fallen to levels seen during the last bear cycle. Whales’ Profit Ratio Hits Bear Market Levels According to CryptoQuant analyst Darkfost, the unrealized profit ratio for ETH whales—traders holding at least 100,000 ETH—has fallen to bear market levels. This cohort of investors last saw this level of unrealized profits in January 2023 and the months before then. Darkfost said that most whales’ positions have returned to the same profit levels recorded during the previous bear market. This is despite the fact that ETH is currently almost twice its value from the last bear season. While the unrealized profit ratio for traders holding at least 100,000 ETH just fell to former bear market levels, the metric for the cohort holding between 1,000 and 10,000 ETH has reverted to negative unrealized profit ratio levels. Additionally, the ETH/BTC ratio continues to decline, with the metric facing a combination of intense fear, uncertainty, and doubt (FUD) and complex price action. Data from TradingView reveals the ETH/BTC price at a five-year low of 0.0246, following a state of constant decline since 2022. Tough Time for ETH Holders This period of difficulty for Ethereum can also be seen in ETH price, which has plummeted 15% monthly and 10% weekly. After a brief surge on Sunday due to news of the United States creating a strategic crypto reserve, including ETH, the cryptocurrency fell more than 20% from $2,541 to $2,019 within 24 hours. At the time of writing, ETH had recovered slightly and was changing hands at $2,232, depicting a 6% uptick daily. At ether’s current price, it is almost 50% below its December 2024 peak above $4,000. Market analysts have predicted that ETH could fall to late 2022 lows of $1,200 after identifying a double-top formation from the asset’s monthly time frame chart. This is likely to happen if ETH breaks below its $2,100 support level. The post Hard Times for ETH Holders: Whales’ Unrealized Profit Ratio Shrinks to Bear Market Levels appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Howard Lutnick Says President Trump to Unveil Bitcoin Reserve Strategy This Week
body: Bitcoin Magazine Howard Lutnick Says President Trump to Unveil Bitcoin Reserve Strategy This Week Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick revealed in an interview on Tuesday that President Donald Trump plans to announce a bitcoin strategic reserve later this week. Speaking to independent news outlet The Pavlovic Today , Lutnick stated that the President “definitely thinks there’s a bitcoin strategic reserve” and will unveil plans for it during the White House’s inaugural crypto summit on Friday. JUST IN: Commerce Secretary says President Trump will unveil a #Bitcoin reserve strategy at the White House Crypto Summit. pic.twitter.com/PiwIMznoag — Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) March 5, 2025 Lutnick hinted that bitcoin would have a “unique status” compared to other cryptocurrencies under the reserve framework. “Bitcoin is one thing, and then the other currencies, the other crypto tokens, I think, will be treated differently—positively, but differently,” he remarked. The Commerce Secretary’s comments align with President Trump’s recent social media posts supporting the creation of a crypto reserve anchored by bitcoin. The President stated the reserve would “elevate this critical industry after years of corrupt attacks by the Biden Administration.” Lutnick’s preview of the announcement propelled bitcoin over $90,000 this week from under $85,000 on Monday. The overall crypto market surged back above $3 trillion ahead of the summit. Friday’s gathering will convene top bitcoin and crypto executives, investors, and regulators to map out a framework for crypto oversight and innovation in the U.S. Attendees include Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong, Kraken CEO Jesse Powell, MicroStrategy Chairman Michael Saylor, and others. The summit follows Trump’s executive order directing officials to prioritize the “responsible growth of digital assets.” The President aims to reposition the U.S. as the “crypto capital of the world” after strict policies under Biden stifled innovation. With bipartisan support growing for bitcoin and crypto-friendly laws in Congress, Trump’s embrace of a strategic bitcoin reserve may cement their legitimacy worldwide. This post Howard Lutnick Says President Trump to Unveil Bitcoin Reserve Strategy This Week first appeared on Bitcoin Magazine and is written by Vivek Sen Bitcoin .

The firm’s report points to impressive use cases and incoming mass institutional adoption for both assets. 2025 Will Be The Year Of The Altcoins, Says WisdomTree After the regulatory milestones achieved by Bitcoin and Ethereum in 2024, WisdomTree says 2025 will see altcoins record similar wins. WisdomTree’s Market Outlook predicts that key jurisdictions will warm up to exchange-traded funds for top altcoins in 2025. title: Are Transfers and Storage of Tether USDT Allowed in Europe?
body: Representatives of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) have spoken out regarding the legal status of stablecoins falling outside of the Market in Cryptoassets Regulation (MiCA), adding a new dose of ambiguity to an already murky regulatory landscape. Shortly before, one of the largest centralised exchanges, Binance, announced a procedure to delist MiCA-compliant staples, including Tether's flagship USDT , for users in the European Economic Area (EEA). However, despite the scheduled 31 March trading exclusion, Binance has made it clear that it will continue to provide deposits and withdrawals using ” unwanted ” staples, adding fuel to the fire of regulatory uncertainty. According to ESMA's position, the provision of custodial and transfer services for such assets does not fall under a breach of European cryptocurrency law, leaving room for manoeuvre for exchanges and users alike. ”Focusing on MiCA, the provision of custody and transaction services for non-compliant assets, do not constitute a public offer or admission to trading,” commented an ESMA spokesperson. ”These services are therefore not explicitly prohibited under Titles III and IV of MiCA.” While the Regulator has made such statements, it has also emphasised that European cryptoasset service providers (CASPs) are obliged to limit the ability to interact with these types of assets , referring to its guidance issued on 17 January 2025 . This requirement must be met by 31 March for investors to successfully close out their positions. At the same time, ESMA's confirmation that MiCA requirements do not restrict interactions involving custody or transactions involving USDT, together with the recommendation for CASP to suspend withdrawals before 31 March , adds ambiguity to this issue. Juan Ignacio Ibáñez , who is a member of MiCA's tech committee, has previously said that the delisting of USDT due to regulatory requirements will be a point of contention. Confusion over MiCA's implications for incompatible stablecoins is not the only area of debate regarding Europe's new cryptocurrency regulations. Many crypto analysts have already said that there will be questions about MICA compliance, because it does not provide clarity on the regulation of RWAs, and other industries. ”ESMA and other competent authorities are closely monitoring the market environment to ensure a centralised transition to the MiCA regime,” said an ESMA spokesperson.

title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: BTC Rebounds To Briefly Reclaim $90,000
body: Bitcoin (BTC)’s recovery has gathered pace as it reclaimed $90,000 after rebounding from a low of $81,947. The flagship cryptocurrency is up over 8% and is trading around $90,100 as bulls attempt to build momentum and push towards $95,000. Markets began recovering after Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick reportedly stated Trump could roll back tariffs against Canada and Mexico, with an announcement likely on March 5. South Korea May Approve Bitcoin ETFs South Korea’s financial regulators are monitoring Japan’s moves towards approving Bitcoin ETFs. Some reports have suggested Seoul may follow Tokyo if it takes further action and approves the ETFs. South Korea’s Financial Services Commission (FSC) has discussed approving the ETFs but maintains a cautious stance towards crypto. However, recent developments in Japan could change their conservative approach towards crypto. The Japanese Financial Services Agency (FSA) is considering reclassifying cryptocurrency as an investment tool and approving Bitcoin ETFs. The shift in stance has caught the attention of South Korean regulators. The FSA plans to implement new regulations by June, setting the stage for further legislative changes by 2025 or 2026. Bitcoin Open Interest Hits Six-Month Low Bitcoin’s open interest has hit a six-month low, a level last seen when BTC traded between $50,000 and $60,000 before surging towards $100,000. One analyst has pointed out that this pattern has previously signaled market bottoms, indicating Bitcoin could be ready for a comeback. “Bitcoin's open interest crashes to 6-month low! But here's the thing: the last time this happened, BTC rallied to $100k! Is history about to repeat itself?” BTC’s funding rate has also dipped into negative territory, an indicator that typically precedes a strong upward push. The RSI is also below the neutral zone, indicating BTC could rebound. However, BTC must reclaim key resistance levels before a bullish reversal can be confirmed. “If You Missed It: The $BTC RSI is below 30, which indicates BTC is significantly oversold! The last time we went below a 30 RSI was early August when BTC hit a bottom of $50k before soaring over 115% and smashing a new all-time high!” Trump Crypto Plan And Market Uncertainty Fueling Volatility BTC’s weekend jump was driven by Donald Trump’s announcement of a crypto strategic reserve that would hold XRP, SOL, and ADA. The brief exclusion of BTC and ETH sparked confusion and panic before Trump confirmed their inclusion in a follow-up post, boosting prices. However, the rally lost momentum due to several factors, including criticism from the industry about the inclusion of assets besides BTC , dampening the initial euphoria around the announcement. Macroeconomic uncertainty and tariffs against Canada, Mexico, and China triggered a broader risk-off move, leading to a substantial decline on Monday. El Salvador Adds To BTC Reserve El Salvador had added 1 BTC to its Bitcoin reserve, taking its total holdings to 6,101.18 BTC , valued at $527 million. The acquisition reinforces President Nayib Bukele’s commitment to strengthen El Salvador’s Bitcoin strategy. The country’s National Bitcoin Office confirmed the purchase on March 4. The move aligns with El Salvador’s “1 BTC a day” accumulation strategy aimed at economic diversification and acting as a hedge against inflation. It also indicates El Salvador’s confidence in BTC despite recent volatility. The country’s latest acquisition comes as it adjusts its Bitcoin policies to align with the $1.4 billion loan agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). El Salvador recently modified its Bitcoin law, making its use voluntary instead of mandatory. Despite the adjustment, El Salvador continues to bolster its Bitcoin reserves. The country has added 46 BTC worth $3.97 million in the past 30 days. Bitcoin (BTC) Price Analysis Bitcoin (BTC) has rebounded over the past couple of sessions as it looks to rebound from Monday’s crash. The flagship cryptocurrency is up over 7% in the past 24 hours, rebounding from a low of $81,485 to briefly cross $90,000 before settling at its current level. BTC faces resistance at $90,000 and $92,000, with sellers preventing a push higher. BTC traded in the red for most of the previous week, starting with a drop of nearly 5% on Monday. BTC continued to drop on Tuesday as it slipped below $90,000 on its way to an intraday low of $85,985. The price recovered from this level but could not reclaim $90,000, ultimately settling at $88,654 after a drop of 3.24%. BTC continued to decline on Wednesday, dropping over 5% to $84,129 as selling pressure intensified. BTC recovered on Thursday despite the overwhelming bearish sentiment, reaching an intraday high of $87,045 before settling at $84,657 after a marginal increase. Source: TradingView The price plunged below $80,000 and the 200-day SMA on Friday, falling to a low of $78,179. However, it recovered from this level to reclaim $80,000 and cross the 200-day SMA to settle at $84,362, registering a marginal decline. BTC recovered on Saturday, rising over 2% and settling at $86,182. Bullish sentiment intensified on Saturday following Donald Trump’s announcement about the strategic reserve. As a result, BTC surged over 9% to reclaim $90,000 and move past the 20-day SMA to settle at $94,322. However, the rally was short-lived as prices crashed on Monday, with BTC dropping 8.61% to $86,201. The price plunged to an intraday low of $81,485 on Tuesday as selling pressure intensified. However, it rebounded from this level to register an increase of nearly 2% and settle at $87,300. The current session sees BTC up over 1% and trading at $88,364 after briefly crossing $90,000 and reaching a high of $90,980. The RSI is below the neutral zone but pointing upwards, indicating a waning bearish sentiment. The MACD also suggests bears are weakening. If BTC reclaims and consolidates above $90,000, it could indicate a change in sentiment. If BTC can settle above the 20-day SMA, it could open the door for a retest of $100,000. On the other hand, if the price drops below $85,000, we could see a decline to $80,000. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: The Current State Of The IRS Broker Rule
body: Bitcoin Magazine The Current State Of The IRS Broker Rule Between the holidays and New Years, the IRS used the last passing days of the Biden administration to finalize its long feared Broker Rule : a regulation requiring all cryptocurrency exchanges – custodial and non-custodial, fiat to crypto and crypto to crypto – to effectively subject their users to Know-Your-Customer (KYC) measures. The rule establishes that custody over funds is not necessary to be deemed a broker by the IRS, obliging “DeFi front-end services” to report trading activity via the 1099 tax form to the agency. This includes any developer of “screens, buttons, forms, and other visual elements incorporated in websites, mobile device apps, and browser extensions—that users can use to trade digital assets in their unhosted wallets”. With its broker rule, the IRS deems said developers to have a certain amount of “control” over the offered services, despite never taking custody of coins and the lack of ability to influence the underlying protocols – the rule is in line with digital asset guidance from the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), which deems developers of user interfaces to qualify as Virtual Asset Service Providers subject to anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism obligations. Similar to FATF, the broker rule defines control as “the ability to amend, update, or otherwise substantively affect the terms under which the services are provided,” as well as “the ability to collect the fees charged for those services from the transaction flow whether or not the person actually collects fees in this manner,” and/or if that person has the ability “to add to the order a sequence of instructions to query the cryptographically secured distributed ledger to determine if the processed order is, in fact, executed or to use another method of confirmation based on information known to that person as a result of providing the trading front-end services.” In light of such enormous overreach – control over funds has been widely understood as a prerequisite to be regulated as a financial service according to FinCEN guidance – the industry moved quickly. A day after publication of the rule, the Blockchain Association filed a lawsuit against the IRS and the Treasury Department, asking federal judges to strike the rule down before it takes effect, alleging that the rule is unconstitutional and contrary to existing federal laws. In addition to the suit, Senator Ted Cruz introduced a joint resolution to disapprove of the IRS’ rule by Congressional power, co-sponsored by Senator Cynthia Lummis, Senator Bill Hagerty, Senator Mike Lee, and Senator Tim Scott, among others. “This regulation undermines the purpose of DeFi technology: to enable individuals to freely buy, sell, and exchange digital assets,” Cruz said in a press release regarding the resolution. Representative Corey, who introduced the resolution together with Cruz, called the rule a “clear overreach”. The resolution was voted on yesterday in the Senate, with overwhelming support of 70 to 27 in favor, and will now move for a vote in the House. The broker rule is another effort of the Biden administration to extend control over non-custodial services. In both the criminal prosecution of Samourai Developers, as well as the criminal prosecution of Tornado Cash developers, the US Department of Justice is alleging that control over funds is not necessary to be held liable as a money service business under US law, arguing that the development of user interfaces and other features demonstrate enough control over a service to be subjected to sanctions, anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism regulations. While the possible overturning of the broker rule would no doubt be a success, the sentencing of Samourai and Tornado Cash developers would yield similar results regarding reporting requirements for non-custodial service providers. To clarify that non-custodial service providers are exempt from being classified as money service businesses, the Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act by Representative Tom Emmer has been introduced to Congress, offering widespread protections for developers. This is a guest post by L0la L33tz. Opinions expressed are entirely their own and do not necessarily reflect those of BTC Inc or Bitcoin Magazine. This post The Current State Of The IRS Broker Rule first appeared on Bitcoin Magazine and is written by L0La L33Tz .

title: Shocking Crypto Robbery Attempt in South Korea Leads to Swift Arrest
body: In a brazen turn of events in South Korea, a man’s attempt to execute a crypto robbery has backfired spectacularly, leading to his swift arrest. What initially seemed like a simple case of theft quickly unraveled into a deeper plot, exposing the risky underbelly of in-person cryptocurrency transactions. Let’s dive into the details of this fascinating case that has gripped the attention of the crypto community and law enforcement alike. Failed Crypto Robbery: A Detailed Breakdown The incident, which unfolded recently, involved a South Korean man in his 30s and two Chinese nationals. According to reports from Newsis, the suspect orchestrated a meeting under the guise of purchasing cryptocurrency. However, his true intentions were far from legitimate. Instead of engaging in a genuine crypto deal, he planned to rob the Chinese nationals of their assets. Here’s a breakdown of how the failed robbery unfolded: The Setup: The suspect arranged a meeting with two Chinese nationals, seemingly to buy cryptocurrency. The location and time were presumably chosen by the suspect to facilitate his planned crime. False Alarm: After the encounter, the suspect contacted the police, making a false claim that he was robbed of 30 million won (approximately $20,600). This initial report was likely an attempt to mislead the authorities and perhaps even frame the Chinese nationals. Truth Unveiled: Police investigations quickly revealed the suspect’s deception. It turned out he was not the victim but the perpetrator of the attempted robbery. His fabricated story crumbled under scrutiny. Swift Arrest: Based on the evidence gathered, South Korean police promptly arrested the man. He now faces serious charges related to his criminal actions. Charges and Further Investigation: Currently, the suspect is charged with attempted robbery. Authorities are also considering adding charges for obstructing official duties due to his false police report. This case serves as a stark reminder of the potential dangers associated with in-person cryptocurrency transactions, especially when dealing with unknown parties. It also highlights the effectiveness of South Korean law enforcement in swiftly addressing and resolving such cryptocurrency crime incidents. Why South Korea and Crypto Crime? South Korea has emerged as a significant hub for cryptocurrency trading and adoption. This prominence, however, also makes it a landscape where crypto robbery and related crimes can occur. Several factors contribute to this: High Crypto Adoption: South Korea has one of the highest rates of cryptocurrency adoption globally. A significant portion of the population is involved in crypto trading and investment, creating a large market and potential targets for criminals. Tech-Savvy Population: The country boasts a highly tech-savvy population, comfortable with digital transactions and technologies. This familiarity extends to cryptocurrencies, but also to potential exploitation by criminals who are equally tech-adept. Large Trading Volumes: Major South Korean exchanges consistently handle substantial cryptocurrency trading volumes. This liquidity and activity can attract both legitimate users and those with malicious intent. Anonymity and Decentralization: The inherent anonymity and decentralized nature of cryptocurrencies can be exploited by criminals looking to conduct illicit activities, including robbery and theft, as tracing and recovering stolen crypto can be complex. The Arrest: A Win for Law Enforcement? The swift arrest in this case can be seen as a positive sign. It demonstrates the capability of South Korean law enforcement to investigate and respond effectively to cryptocurrency-related crimes. Here’s why this arrest is significant: Deterrent Effect: Publicizing such arrests can act as a deterrent to potential criminals. Knowing that law enforcement is actively pursuing and successfully prosecuting crypto-related crimes can discourage others from attempting similar acts. Building Public Trust: Successful resolution of crypto crime cases helps build public trust in the ability of authorities to protect digital assets. This is crucial for the continued growth and acceptance of cryptocurrencies within society. Enhanced Investigative Capabilities: Each case provides valuable learning opportunities for law enforcement agencies. Investigating crypto robbery and fraud requires specialized skills and understanding of blockchain technology. Successful arrests indicate growing expertise in this area. International Cooperation: In cases involving foreign nationals, like this one with Chinese nationals, it highlights the importance of international cooperation in tackling cross-border crypto crimes. Protecting Yourself from Cryptocurrency Crime While law enforcement plays a crucial role, individual vigilance and proactive security measures are paramount in protecting yourself from becoming a victim of cryptocurrency crime . Here are some actionable insights to consider: Exercise Caution with In-Person Transactions: Whenever possible, avoid in-person cryptocurrency transactions, especially with unknown individuals. Opt for reputable exchanges and platforms for buying and selling crypto. Use Secure Wallets: Employ hardware wallets or reputable software wallets to store your cryptocurrencies securely. Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) for added security. Be Wary of Unsolicited Offers: Be extremely cautious of unsolicited investment offers or deals that seem too good to be true. Scammers often use social engineering tactics to lure victims. Verify Counterparties: If in-person transactions are unavoidable, conduct thorough due diligence on the counterparty. Meet in secure, public places and inform someone of your plans. Stay Informed: Keep yourself updated on the latest cryptocurrency scams and security threats. Knowledge is your best defense against falling victim to crime. The Future of Crypto Security in South Korea As cryptocurrency adoption continues to grow in South Korea and globally, ensuring the security of digital assets will remain a top priority. The South Korea arrest in this failed robbery case is a step in the right direction, but ongoing efforts are needed. This includes: Strengthening Legal Frameworks: Governments and regulatory bodies need to continuously adapt legal frameworks to effectively address the evolving landscape of cryptocurrency crime. Clear regulations and enforcement mechanisms are essential. Technological Advancements: Continued development and deployment of blockchain analytics and forensic tools are crucial for tracking illicit crypto transactions and identifying criminals. Public Awareness Campaigns: Raising public awareness about cryptocurrency risks and security best practices is vital. Educating users is key to preventing many types of crypto crime. Collaboration Between Stakeholders: Effective crypto security requires collaboration between law enforcement, exchanges, wallet providers, and the crypto community as a whole. Sharing information and best practices is essential. Conclusion: A Stark Reminder of Crypto Risks The failed robbery attempt and subsequent arrest in South Korea serve as a dramatic and shocking illustration of the real-world risks associated with cryptocurrency transactions. While the digital realm offers incredible opportunities, it also presents challenges in terms of security and crime. This incident underscores the need for vigilance, robust security measures, and continued efforts from law enforcement and the crypto industry to create a safer environment for everyone involved in the exciting world of cryptocurrencies. The swift action of South Korean police provides a glimmer of hope and a strong message that cryptocurrency crime will not go unpunished. To learn more about the latest crypto security trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto crime prevention and digital asset protection.

title: Elizabeth Warren says Trump, Musk, and DOGE are aiding the wealthy to cheat on their taxes
body: Senator Elizabeth Warren has accused former President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk of aiding the wealthy in avoiding taxes. She believes the Trump and Musk are pressing the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to reduce the workforce to obscure tax delays for billionaires in America. On Wednesday, Warren reposted an article from the Associated Press on X with the quote: “ Donald Trump and Elon Musk are happy to make you wait for your tax refund, just so the wealthy can cheat on their taxes. How is that efficient? ” The AP news talked about a potential IRS staff cuts that could eliminate nearly half of its workforce. According to sources familiar with the situation, the agency is drafting plans to reduce its workforce through layoffs, attrition, and incentivized buyouts. As previously reported by Cryptopolitan, the IRS currently employs approximately 90,000 workers across the United States. Data from the office’s records shows that 56% of its workforce consists of people of color, and 65% are women. In February, around 7,000 probationary employees, those with one year or less of service, were already laid off as part of the downsizing effort. Trump’s administration plans to shrink the federal government is led by Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency. The department was created to overhaul federal agencies and is now pushing for a reduction in government employee numbers, including nearly all probationary workers who have yet to secure civil service protections. Warren condemns Trump’s tax policies In a video posted after Trump’s State of the Union address on Tuesday, she called the US President’s remarks “layers and layers of ugliness, distraction, and crazy stories that would make a fact-checker’s head explode.” Donald Trump is handing our country over to a handful of billionaires. pic.twitter.com/jtrZyp9gB6 — Elizabeth Warren (@SenWarren) March 5, 2025 “ I think Trump and Republicans in Congress have a plan to cut taxes for billionaires and to make everyone else pay for it, ” Warren said. “ And the best way to slip through a plan like that is to throw up a handful of sand after another, hoping that nobody will actually see what’s happening. “ She went on to accuse Trump of handing America over to “a handful of billionaires.” At a press conference held yesterday evening, Warren was joined by Boston Mayor Michelle Wu, Senator Ed Markey, and the Massachusetts Congressional Delegation. Among those joining Warren was Doug Kowalewski, a former National Science Foundation employee from Wellesley. Kowalewski was among those unexpectedly dismissed as part of the workforce reductions initiated by Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency. He had previously shared his story at Warren’s town hall in Framingham, Massachusetts. The group condemned what they described as Trump’s agenda to benefit billionaires at the expense of working-class Americans. Warren referred to the first six weeks of Trump’s new administration as a “sandstorm of chaos,” arguing that the “distraction tactics” were meant to push through trillions in tax cuts that would gut healthcare, Social Security, and other programs that “mommas, daddies, babies and seniors rely on.” Warren: ‘Billionaires win, families lose’ Continuing with her statement , Warren pointed a finger at Trump and Musk for systematically dismantling the federal government to serve the interests of the wealthy. “ Trump and his unelected co-president Elon Musk are dismantling our government, piece by piece so that it works better for those same billionaires and worse for everyone else ,” she said. “ The whole Republican plan fits on a bumper sticker: Billionaires win; families lose .” She further accused Trump of failing to deliver on promises to lower costs, instead slashing funding for medical research and laying off government employees responsible for airline safety, nuclear materials security, and food inspection. On Wednesday morning, she doubled down on her stance against the alleged tax breaks for the wealthy, posting on X: “ I won’t vote to give tax breaks to billionaires. “ Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? Learn how to do it with DeFi in our upcoming webclass. Save Your Spot

title: Hope Restored: zkLend Unveils Recovery Portal After $9.5M DeFi Exploit
body: In a whirlwind of events for the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, zkLend, a prominent lending protocol built on Starknet, recently faced a significant security breach. This unfortunate incident resulted in approximately $9.5 million being siphoned from the platform. However, in a swift and reassuring move, zkLend has demonstrated its commitment to its users by launching a dedicated recovery portal. This portal is designed to facilitate the refund process for users impacted by the exploit. Let’s dive into the details of this incident, understand the implications, and explore how zkLend is taking steps to rectify the situation and reinforce DeFi security . Understanding the zkLend Exploit and its Impact The exploit, which sent ripples through the Starknet ecosystem and the broader DeFi community, highlighted the ever-present risks in the nascent world of decentralized finance. While details of the exact vulnerability exploited are still being analyzed, the outcome was clear: a substantial amount of funds was compromised. For users of zkLend, this meant potential losses and a significant disruption to their DeFi activities. The immediate aftermath of such an exploit is always critical, testing the resilience and responsiveness of the affected protocol. zkLend’s prompt action in addressing the issue and establishing a recovery portal signals a proactive approach to user protection and trust restoration. To put the incident into perspective, consider these key points: Magnitude of Loss: Approximately $9.5 million was lost, a considerable sum even within the high-stakes environment of DeFi. Platform Affected: zkLend, a lending protocol on Starknet, known for its focus on scalability and lower gas fees. User Impact: Users who had deposited or were lending assets on zkLend were directly affected by the exploit. Community Reaction: The DeFi community closely watched zkLend’s response, as such incidents serve as crucial learning moments for the entire ecosystem. The Beacon of Hope: zkLend’s Recovery Portal In the face of adversity, zkLend’s announcement of a recovery portal acts as a beacon of hope for affected users. This portal is not just a symbolic gesture; it’s a concrete mechanism for users to begin the process of reclaiming their lost funds. But how does this recovery portal actually work, and what does it mean for users? Here’s a breakdown of what we know about the zkLend recovery initiative: Purpose-Built System: The portal is specifically designed to handle claims related to the recent exploit. This focused approach is crucial for efficient processing and management of user requests. User-Centric Design: zkLend has emphasized user-friendliness in the portal’s design, aiming to make the recovery process as smooth and transparent as possible for those affected. Transparency and Communication: zkLend’s communication via X (formerly Twitter) and the launch of the portal itself demonstrate a commitment to transparency, which is vital in regaining user trust after a security incident. Step-by-Step Guidance: The portal likely provides clear instructions and steps for users to submit their claims, ensuring even less technically savvy users can navigate the process. While the specifics of the portal’s operation will unfold as users begin to engage with it, the very existence of this crypto refund mechanism is a significant positive development. It underscores zkLend’s responsibility towards its community and sets a precedent for how DeFi protocols should respond to security breaches. Why DeFi Security Remains Paramount The zkLend exploit is a stark reminder of why DeFi security is not just a buzzword but a foundational necessity for the sustainable growth of decentralized finance. The promise of DeFi – open access, transparency, and user control – is intrinsically linked to the security and robustness of these platforms. When exploits occur, they not only cause financial harm but also erode trust in the entire DeFi ecosystem. Let’s consider why security is so critical in the DeFi landscape: Aspect Importance for DeFi Security Trust and Adoption Users need to trust that their funds are safe. Frequent exploits can deter mainstream adoption and limit the potential of DeFi. Financial Risk Mitigation DeFi protocols handle substantial amounts of user funds. Robust security measures are essential to minimize financial risks and prevent devastating losses. Smart Contract Vulnerabilities DeFi relies heavily on smart contracts, which, if not rigorously audited and tested, can contain vulnerabilities that malicious actors can exploit. Ecosystem Stability The interconnected nature of DeFi means that an exploit on one protocol can have cascading effects on others. Strong security contributes to the overall stability of the DeFi ecosystem. Regulatory Scrutiny Increasing regulatory attention on DeFi necessitates a proactive approach to security to demonstrate responsible platform operation and user protection. Incidents like the zkLend exploit, while unfortunate, serve as crucial learning opportunities for the DeFi space. They highlight the need for continuous improvement in security practices, smart contract auditing, and incident response protocols. Lessons Learned and Moving Forward: Strengthening Starknet and Beyond The zkLend incident, while specific to this protocol on Starknet, offers valuable lessons for the entire DeFi ecosystem, including the Starknet network itself. What actionable insights can we glean from this situation to bolster Starknet security and DeFi in general? Here are key takeaways and steps for improvement: Enhanced Smart Contract Audits: Protocols should invest in rigorous and frequent smart contract audits from reputable security firms. These audits should go beyond surface-level checks and delve deep into potential vulnerabilities. Proactive Vulnerability Disclosure Programs: Encouraging white-hat hackers to identify and responsibly disclose vulnerabilities through bug bounty programs can significantly strengthen security. Incident Response Planning: Having a well-defined incident response plan in place is crucial. zkLend’s swift action in launching a recovery portal is a positive example of incident response. Community Vigilance and Education: The DeFi community, including users, developers, and auditors, must remain vigilant and continuously educate themselves about emerging security threats and best practices. Layer 2 Security Focus: As Layer 2 solutions like Starknet gain prominence, dedicated attention must be given to their specific security considerations and potential attack vectors. For zkLend, the immediate focus is on the successful operation of the recovery portal and ensuring that affected users are appropriately compensated. Looking ahead, it will be critical for zkLend and other DeFi protocols to implement robust security enhancements to prevent similar incidents and foster greater user confidence. Conclusion: A Path to Recovery and a More Secure DeFi Future The $9.5 million exploit on zkLend was undoubtedly a setback, highlighting the inherent risks within the DeFi space. However, zkLend’s decisive action in launching a recovery portal offers a significant silver lining. This initiative not only provides a pathway for users to reclaim their funds but also sends a powerful message about accountability and user protection in DeFi. The incident underscores the critical importance of DeFi security , robust smart contract audits, and proactive incident response. As the DeFi ecosystem matures, learning from such incidents and implementing stronger security measures will be paramount to building a more resilient, trustworthy, and ultimately, more accessible financial future. zkLend’s response, particularly the establishment of the recovery portal , is a commendable step forward in this ongoing journey towards greater DeFi security and user empowerment. To learn more about the latest DeFi trends, explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi innovation and security enhancements.

title: 4 Altcoins to Sell Ahead of Trump’s Crypto Summit on March 7 to Avoid Long Term Losses
body: As of March 7, the crypto market is in recovery following weeks of corrections. However, bearish momentum remains strong, keeping most cryptocurrencies near their support levels. title: Urgent Crypto Warning: Bithumb Exposes Potential Ponzi Scheme Risks with Quantvine!
body: Cryptocurrency investors, are you aware of the hidden dangers lurking in the seemingly lucrative world of automated crypto investment platforms? South Korean crypto giant Bithumb has just dropped a bombshell, issuing a stark Bithumb warning to its users about potential Ponzi scheme risks associated with Quantvine. This news has sent ripples through the crypto community, raising serious questions about the safety of automated investment platforms and the ever-present threat of crypto ponzi scheme operations. Why is Bithumb Sounding the Alarm on Quantvine? According to an official announcement on Bithumb’s website, the exchange has flagged concerns regarding Quantvine, an automated crypto investment platform. Bithumb’s primary worry centers around the possibility that Quantvine might be operating as an illegal Ponzi scheme. This is a serious allegation that demands immediate attention from anyone involved or considering engaging with Quantvine. Here’s what we know from Bithumb’s official statement: Official Warning: Bithumb has explicitly warned users about potential illegal Ponzi concerns linked to Quantvine. Withdrawal Restrictions: Users attempting to withdraw crypto to addresses linked to Quantvine may face rejection, particularly for registrations under KRW 1 million. This is a significant step taken by Bithumb to protect its users. User Caution Advised: Bithumb strongly advises users to exercise extreme caution when dealing with Quantvine, especially concerning withdrawals and further investments. This isn’t just a minor advisory; it’s a clear red flag from a major South Korean crypto exchange . Bithumb’s proactive stance highlights the ongoing battle against fraudulent schemes in the volatile crypto market. But what exactly makes Quantvine a potential Ponzi risk, and how can you protect yourself? Understanding the Red Flags: Spotting a Crypto Ponzi Scheme Ponzi schemes, in the crypto world or otherwise, operate on a simple yet devastatingly effective premise: paying early investors with money from newer investors. This creates a facade of high returns, enticing more people to invest, until the scheme inevitably collapses when new investments dry up. Here are some tell-tale signs of a potential crypto ponzi scheme , which might be relevant in the Quantvine situation and are crucial for any crypto investor to recognize: Red Flag Description Unrealistically High Returns Promises of guaranteed, exceptionally high returns with little to no risk are a major red flag. Legitimate investments always carry risk. Consistent Returns Regardless of Market Conditions Crypto markets are volatile. A platform claiming consistent profits regardless of market ups and downs is suspicious. Complex or Secretive Strategies Ponzi schemes often use complex jargon or vague explanations about how they generate profits to obfuscate their lack of real investment activities. Pressure to Recruit Others Many Ponzi schemes rely on network marketing or referral programs, incentivizing existing investors to bring in new ones. Withdrawal Difficulties As Bithumb’s warning indicates, difficulties or delays in withdrawals are a critical warning sign that the scheme may be running out of new money to pay investors. While it’s important to note that these are potential red flags and further investigation is always needed, Bithumb’s Bithumb warning about Quantvine strongly suggests that some of these concerns are present. Quantvine: What We Know About the Platform Quantvine markets itself as an automated crypto investment platform, often promising high returns through sophisticated trading algorithms or strategies. While automated trading can be legitimate, it also presents an avenue for fraudulent schemes to attract unsuspecting investors. Key aspects to consider regarding Quantvine, in light of Bithumb’s warning: Lack of Transparency: Is Quantvine transparent about its trading strategies and how it generates returns? Vague descriptions should raise concerns. Regulatory Compliance: Is Quantvine registered and compliant with relevant financial regulations in its operating jurisdiction? Lack of regulatory oversight is a significant risk factor. Independent Reviews: Are there credible, independent reviews or audits of Quantvine’s operations and performance? Be wary of testimonials that seem too good to be true or are affiliated with the platform. Bithumb’s Action: The fact that a reputable South Korean crypto exchange like Bithumb has issued a public warning is in itself a major point of concern and should not be taken lightly. Navigating Crypto Investment Risks: Actionable Insights Bithumb’s Bithumb warning serves as a crucial reminder of the inherent crypto investment risks in the digital asset space. Here are some actionable steps you can take to protect yourself from potential Ponzi schemes and other crypto scams: Due Diligence is Paramount: Before investing in any crypto platform, especially those promising automated returns, conduct thorough research. Investigate the platform’s team, technology, and regulatory compliance. Question Unrealistic Promises: If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. Be skeptical of platforms guaranteeing high, consistent returns. Diversify Your Investments: Never put all your eggs in one basket. Diversify your crypto portfolio across different assets and platforms to mitigate risk. Start Small: If you’re considering a new platform, start with a small investment to test withdrawals and platform functionality before committing larger sums. Stay Informed: Keep up-to-date with the latest news and warnings from reputable sources like crypto exchanges and regulatory bodies. Bithumb’s warning is a prime example of such crucial information. Seek Independent Financial Advice: Consider consulting with a qualified financial advisor before making significant crypto investments. Conclusion: Heeding the Warning and Protecting Your Crypto Bithumb’s explicit warning about Quantvine and potential crypto ponzi scheme risks is a critical development for the crypto community. It underscores the importance of vigilance, due diligence, and a healthy dose of skepticism when navigating the world of crypto investments. While automated investment platforms can offer convenience, they also carry inherent risks, particularly the danger of falling prey to fraudulent schemes. The situation with Quantvine serves as a potent reminder: protect your crypto assets by staying informed, being cautious, and always prioritizing security over the allure of quick and easy profits. Don’t let the promise of high returns blind you to the very real crypto investment risks . Heed the Bithumb warning and invest wisely. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Trump's Bitcoin Strategic Reserve Faces Skepticism from Senator Cynthia Lummis and Chairman Tim Scott in Congress
body: President Donald Trump's proposal for a U.S. strategic bitcoin reserve has garnered interest among some members of Congress, particularly from pro-Bitcoin Senator Cynthia Lummis. However, Lummis has expressed skepticism regarding the initiative's near-term feasibility, stating that Congress is not yet ready to accept the bill. Despite the proposal gaining traction, Lummis, who introduced the legislation, acknowledges that there is insufficient support for it at this time. Additionally, House Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott is advocating for delays, citing concerns that the U.S. is not prepared for such a move. To continue reading this as well as other DeFi and Web3 news, visit us at thedefiant.io

title: Urgent Crypto Volatility Alert: White House Summit Looms Amid Market Jitters
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts! The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a wild ride this week, and leading Singapore-based trading firm QCP Capital is sounding the alarm. Volatility is surging, creating both opportunities and anxieties in the digital asset space. What’s behind this sudden market turbulence, and what can we expect as the highly anticipated White House Crypto Summit approaches? Let’s dive into the key factors driving this crypto volatility and what it means for your portfolio. Why is Crypto Volatility Surging? According to QCP Capital’s recent Telegram update, a confluence of global events is fueling the current crypto volatility . It’s not just one factor, but a combination of macroeconomic uncertainties and geopolitical tensions creating a perfect storm in the crypto market. Let’s break down the key drivers: Trump’s Crypto Reserve Plan: Rumors and speculation surrounding a potential crypto reserve plan initiated by former President Trump are injecting uncertainty into the market. While details remain scarce, the mere suggestion of such a plan is enough to trigger market fluctuations as investors try to anticipate its potential impact. Escalating U.S. Tariffs: The U.S. is ramping up trade tensions with key partners, increasing tariffs on goods from Canada, Mexico, and China. These escalating tariffs are creating ripples of unease throughout global markets, and crypto is not immune. Trade wars often lead to economic uncertainty, which in turn can drive investors towards or away from risk assets like cryptocurrencies. Retaliatory Measures: As expected, these tariff hikes are met with retaliatory measures from the affected countries. This tit-for-tat trade war intensifies macroeconomic uncertainty and further fuels market volatility across asset classes, including crypto. Hints of Tariff Rollback & Macroeconomic Uncertainty: Adding another layer of complexity, the U.S. Commerce Secretary has hinted at a possible partial rollback of tariffs. While seemingly positive, this mixed messaging contributes to—you guessed it—more macroeconomic uncertainty. The market hates uncertainty, and this flip-flopping on trade policy is exacerbating the crypto volatility we’re currently witnessing. Crypto-Equities Link: It’s increasingly clear that the crypto market is becoming more closely correlated with traditional equities. When macroeconomic uncertainty rises and equity markets become volatile, crypto markets tend to follow suit. This interconnectedness means that global economic jitters directly translate into fluctuations in the crypto space. In essence, the current crypto volatility is a symptom of broader global economic and political tensions. It’s a reminder that the crypto market, while operating in its own unique sphere, is still deeply intertwined with traditional financial systems and global events. White House Crypto Summit: Will it Calm the Waters? Amidst this swirling crypto volatility , the first-ever White House Crypto Summit is scheduled for March 7th. This summit is generating considerable buzz and anticipation within the crypto community. Will it be a turning point for crypto regulation and adoption in the U.S., or just another talking shop? QCP Capital highlights a crucial point: market participants are approaching the summit with caution. Here’s why skepticism is prevailing, despite the potential significance of a White House summit dedicated to crypto: Lack of Concrete Action: Summits are often high on rhetoric but low on tangible outcomes. Unless the White House Crypto Summit results in concrete executive orders, specific funding plans, or clear pathways for congressional support, the market is unlikely to react with bullish enthusiasm. Words alone are not enough to quell the current crypto volatility or inspire lasting confidence. Market Sentiment: After periods of heightened volatility and uncertainty, market participants tend to become more risk-averse. They are looking for solid evidence of positive change, not just promises. The summit needs to deliver more than just optimistic statements to shift the prevailing cautious sentiment. Regulatory Landscape: The regulatory landscape for crypto in the U.S. remains murky and fragmented. Investors are seeking clarity and consistency in regulation. If the summit can pave the way for a more unified and supportive regulatory framework, it could significantly reduce long-term crypto volatility and attract institutional investment. In short, while the White House Crypto Summit is a welcome development, the crypto market is in a “show-me-the-money” mood. Meaningful action, not just discussion, is needed to truly impact market sentiment and curb the ongoing crypto volatility . Tariffs Impact: How Trade Tensions Fuel Crypto Market Jitters The escalating U.S. tariffs are more than just economic headlines; they are directly contributing to the current crypto markets ‘ unease. But how exactly do tariffs translate into volatility in the digital asset realm? Here’s a breakdown of the connection: Tariff Escalation Impact on Global Economy Consequences for Crypto Markets Increased tariffs on goods from Canada, Mexico, and China Higher costs for businesses and consumers Disruptions to supply chains Reduced global trade volume Potential for slower economic growth Increased risk aversion among investors Flight to safety assets (potentially away from crypto in the short term) Correlation between crypto and traditional risk assets strengthens Crypto markets become more susceptible to macroeconomic news and sentiment Essentially, tariffs create economic uncertainty. This uncertainty spills over into financial markets, causing investors to become more cautious and reactive. Since crypto markets are still considered relatively high-risk assets, they often experience amplified volatility during periods of economic unease driven by factors like tariff disputes. Navigating Economic Uncertainty in Crypto: Strategies for Investors In times of economic uncertainty , like the one we’re currently experiencing, navigating the crypto market requires a strategic and informed approach. Economic uncertainty creates both challenges and opportunities. Here are some actionable insights for crypto investors: Diversification is Key: Don’t put all your eggs in one crypto basket. Diversify your portfolio across different types of cryptocurrencies and even consider allocating a portion to more traditional assets to mitigate risk during volatile periods. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): Instead of trying to time the market, consider using dollar-cost averaging. Invest a fixed amount of money at regular intervals. This strategy can help smooth out the impact of crypto volatility over time. Stay Informed: Keep a close eye on macroeconomic news, geopolitical developments, and regulatory updates. Understanding the factors driving market volatility is crucial for making informed investment decisions. Follow reputable crypto news sources and analysis from firms like QCP Capital. Manage Risk: Only invest what you can afford to lose. Economic uncertainty can lead to unexpected market downturns. Implement risk management strategies such as setting stop-loss orders and carefully assessing your risk tolerance. Long-Term Perspective: Remember that crypto markets are inherently volatile, but they also have significant long-term growth potential. Focus on the long-term fundamentals of the projects you invest in and avoid getting swayed by short-term market fluctuations. Consider Stablecoins: In periods of extreme crypto volatility , consider temporarily parking some of your portfolio in stablecoins. These cryptocurrencies are pegged to fiat currencies like the US dollar and can offer a safe haven during market turbulence. Conclusion: Riding the Crypto Volatility Wave The current surge in crypto volatility , driven by a complex interplay of factors from Trump’s crypto plans to escalating tariffs and macroeconomic uncertainty, presents both challenges and opportunities for crypto investors. The upcoming White House Crypto Summit is a significant event, but its impact will depend on concrete actions rather than just pronouncements. Navigating this period requires a cautious yet informed approach, emphasizing diversification, risk management, and a long-term perspective. While the market may be jittery now, understanding the drivers of crypto volatility and adopting strategic investment practices can help you weather the storm and potentially capitalize on future opportunities in the ever-evolving crypto landscape. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto price action.

title: Donald Trump Spoke for 1 Hour and 38 Minutes, Didn’t Say a Word About Cryptocurrencies: What Does It Mean?
body: US President Donald Trump’s failure to mention cryptocurrencies in his speech to Congress is a notable omission given his recent statements about the sector. According to investment bank TD Cowen, the absence suggests that cryptocurrencies are not a major focus for Trump. TD Cowen’s Washington Research Group, led by Jaret Seiberg, noted in a note published today that this exclusion is significant. “If it was a personal priority, then it would have been in the conversation,” Seiberg wrote, emphasizing that Trump’s decision to leave out crypto was more than just an oversight. The omission is particularly notable given that Trump has been referring to cryptocurrencies in speeches and social media posts in the days leading up to his speech. Seiberg sees this silence as “more significant” than the lack of discussion on other issues like housing and banking, given that Trump has a known stance on crypto policy. Related News: Bitcoin's Long-Awaited Bottom Signal May Have Arrived! "The Price Had Previously Increased by 200 Percent!" Seiberg pointed to potential political motivations behind Trump’s decision, noting that Republicans in Congress are currently trying to secure Democratic support for stablecoin legislation. Any direct involvement by Trump could complicate those negotiations, making it strategically beneficial for him to remain silent on the issue. Another explanation, however, is that Trump does not see crypto as a pressing issue within his broader political agenda. “When Trump appears before crypto investors, he mentions crypto. Yet we continue to believe that this is not a personal priority,” Seiberg said. Overall, Seiberg described Trump's speech as “long on showmanship and short on substance, even for a Donald Trump speech.” *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Donald Trump Spoke for 1 Hour and 38 Minutes, Didn’t Say a Word About Cryptocurrencies: What Does It Mean?

title: Bitcoin Cash soars 30% to lead top coins amid market bounce
body: Bitcoin Cash has traded higher in the past 24 hours, surging by more than 30% to lead top gainers among the largest coins by market capitalization. The price of Bitcoin Cash ( BCH ) rose to an intraday high of $391 during early trading during the U.S. session on March 5, 2025. It marked the altcoin’s highest level since early February, when its price dropped below $400. Notably, BCH price rose amid a breakout from a falling wedge pattern, in place as the altcoin continued its multi-year accumulation phase. Data from IntoTheBlock shows the number of BCH holders in profit has risen slightly to 73%, with this coming amid a surge in whale transactions. BCH outpaces top coins Market data at the time of writing showed Bitcoin Cash price hovered at $389, up nearly 30% and outpacing all the top 10 coins. These include Bitcoin, which changed hands 6.5% up, Ethereum, which was up 7.2% and XRP, 3.9%. With daily trading volume increasing by more than 83% to over $942 million and a market cap of $7.65 billion, Bitcoin Cash also led as the best-performing cryptocurrency among the top 100 by market cap in the last 24 hours. Its intraday gains put BCH above Jito, Ondo Finance and Chainlink, all of which were up between 14% and 22%. BCH also outpaced Arbitrum, which rose by 13% after U.S.-based trading app Robinhood added trading support for ARB. Read more: Bitcoin Cash price prediction: is it time for BCH to shine? A broader market bounce after sharp volatility swung BTC to below $80k, an upward flip had it near $90k. The latest news around tariffs and the U.S.’ crypto reserve helped bulls, largely after Strategy founder Michael Saylor confirmed he will attend the inaugural White House Crypto Summit and Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick’s comments on Wednesday. “Markets are on edge, and crypto is moving in sync with equities,” Singapore-based QCP Capital noted in a post on X. According to analysts at the digital assets platform, Friday’s White House Crypto Summit will be a key event. Next week’s “big macro catalysts” could be the non-farm payrolls report and the consumer price index release, which will be crucial for the market tone, they added . title: Tether Takes ‘Historic’ Step Towards Transparency With Full Audit and New CFO Appointee
body: The stablecoin issuer Tether has hired a new chief financial officer (CFO) and committed to completing a full audit. The veteran finance executive Simon McWilliams will now serve as CFO for Tether, which issues the dollar-pegged USDT , the top stablecoin by market cap. McWilliams will lead the stablecoin issuer toward a full audit and “spearhead Tether’s further commitment to transparency and regulatory readiness,” according to a press release from the firm. Tether didn’t provide a timeline for the audit. The firm already releases quarterly attestation reports with the accounting giant BDO, but it says a full audit will “ensure greater financial integrity and verification of reserves.” The stablecoin issuer has dealt with regulatory issues recently, including failing to gain compliance with the European Union’s new Markets in Crypto Assets (MiCA) regulations, which has led to crypto exchanges delisting USDT in Europe. MiCA establishes rules covering the supervision, consumer protection and environmental safeguards of crypto assets. The regulatory framework includes measures that aim to reduce financial crimes, including market manipulation, money laundering and terrorist financing. It also places stablecoin issuers under the European Banking Authority and requires them to hold sufficient liquid reserves. McWilliams replaces former CFO Giancarlo Devasini, who will now serve as Tether’s “Chairman of the Group.” Don't Miss a Beat – Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: XRP News: Ripple vs SEC Lawsuits To Resolve in March Hint Pro-XRP Lawyer
body: The post XRP News: Ripple vs SEC Lawsuits To Resolve in March Hint Pro-XRP Lawyer appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The long-running legal battle between Ripple and the U.S. SEC has kept the crypto world on edge. While the SEC recently dropped cases against major firms like Coinbase and Kraken , many wonder if Ripple could be next. In an ongoing discussion, pro-XRP lawyer Jeremy Hogan has hinted that a resolution could come to an end as early as March. XRP Lawsuit Coming To An End in March? Legal expert Jeremy Hogan has dropped a major hint about a possible early resolution in the XRP lawsuit, sparking excitement among investors. Meanwhile, in an ongoing discussion, a community member asked Hogan whether the SEC’s recent trend of dropping lawsuits could lead to a quick resolution for Ripple in March, with the injunction issue handled later. Yes, but I'd wait until eveything is hashed out before dismissing the appeals. This all has to be done very carefully. — Jeremy Hogan (@attorneyjeremy1) March 4, 2025 Hogan responded that an early dismissal is possible but warned that all legal matters must be fully settled before celebrating. Adding to the buzz, Hogan also revealed that Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse might attend the White House Crypto Summit. While some questioned the accuracy of this claim, Hogan stood firm, fueling further speculation about a potential game changing moment for Ripple. What’s Next for Ripple Lawsuits The SEC filed its opening appeal on January 15, 2025, and Ripple has until April 16 to respond. Legal experts, including Hogan, have pointed to the injunction on XRP sales as a key reason why the case is still ongoing. Some theories suggest Ripple is trying to lift regulatory restrictions before settling. While the exact reasons for the SEC’s continued pursuit of Ripple remain unclear, one thing is clear this lawsuit is more complex than others the SEC has recently dropped.

title: Sensational Crypto Shift: Trump to Unveil Bitcoin Strategic Reserve at White House Summit
body: Get ready for a potential earthquake in the crypto world! U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has dropped a bombshell, hinting at a seismic shift in the nation’s crypto policy under President Donald Trump. According to The Pavlovic Today, the upcoming White House Crypto Summit on March 7th is set to be the stage for a monumental announcement that could redefine America’s stance on digital currencies. Is a Bitcoin Strategic Reserve on the Horizon? Lutnick’s revelation suggests that President Trump is not just dipping his toes into the crypto waters; he’s planning a full dive! The centerpiece of this anticipated policy shift is the establishment of a national Bitcoin strategic reserve . Imagine the U.S., a global economic powerhouse, holding Bitcoin as a strategic asset, much like gold or oil. This move could send shockwaves through the global financial system and legitimize Bitcoin on an unprecedented scale. But what does this really mean? Validation of Bitcoin: A strategic reserve would signal the U.S. government’s recognition of Bitcoin as a significant digital asset, potentially boosting its credibility and mainstream adoption. Geopolitical Implications: Holding Bitcoin could give the U.S. a strategic advantage in the evolving digital economy, influencing global crypto markets and potentially challenging the dominance of traditional financial systems. Market Impact: The demand surge from a national reserve could dramatically impact Bitcoin’s price, potentially triggering a bull run and attracting further institutional investment. However, questions remain. How large would this reserve be? How would it be managed? And what are the potential risks and benefits of such a bold move? Decoding Trump’s Vision for Crypto Regulation Beyond the Bitcoin strategic reserve , Lutnick indicated that President Trump will also lay out his broader vision for crypto regulation . This is crucial for the industry, which has long grappled with regulatory uncertainty. A clear and comprehensive regulatory framework could either stifle innovation or provide a fertile ground for growth. What can we expect from Trump’s approach? According to Lutnick, while Trump views cryptocurrencies positively, there’s a distinction in his approach. Bitcoin seems to be in favor, but altcoins might face a different regulatory landscape. This bifurcation could lead to: Stricter Scrutiny for Altcoins: Altcoins, which encompass thousands of cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin, might face stricter regulations concerning their issuance, trading, and use. This could be due to concerns about investor protection, market manipulation, and the higher risk profile often associated with newer or less established cryptocurrencies. Favorable Environment for Bitcoin: Bitcoin, as the oldest and most established cryptocurrency, could be positioned as a more regulated and ‘safer’ digital asset under Trump’s policy. This could attract institutional investors who prefer the relative stability and established track record of Bitcoin. Innovation and Compliance Balance: The challenge will be to create regulations that are robust enough to protect consumers and maintain financial stability, yet flexible enough to allow for continued innovation and growth in the crypto space. The details of this regulatory framework are eagerly awaited. Will it be innovation-friendly, or will it impose constraints that could push crypto activity overseas? The White House Crypto Summit: A Pivotal Moment The upcoming White House Crypto Summit on March 7th is shaping up to be a landmark event. It’s not just another industry gathering; it’s a potential turning point for cryptocurrency in the United States and globally. What makes this summit so significant? This summit is significant because it: Elevates Crypto to a National Level: Hosting a summit at the White House signifies that the U.S. government is taking cryptocurrency seriously as a matter of national economic and strategic importance. Signals Policy Direction: The summit is expected to provide clear signals about the future direction of U.S. crypto policy , influencing investment decisions, business strategies, and technological developments in the sector. Brings Key Stakeholders Together: It will likely convene key figures from the crypto industry, government agencies, and traditional finance, fostering dialogue and collaboration on the future of digital assets. The summit’s outcome could set the tone for global crypto regulation and influence how other nations approach digital currencies. The world will be watching closely. Navigating the Altcoin Landscape: Opportunities and Challenges The potential differentiation in regulation between Bitcoin and altcoins presents both opportunities and challenges for investors and developers. What does this mean for the diverse world of cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin? Let’s break down the potential implications for altcoins: Aspect Potential Opportunities for Altcoins Potential Challenges for Altcoins Regulation Clearer regulatory paths for compliant projects; potential for specific niches to thrive under tailored regulations. Increased compliance costs; potential for some altcoins to be deemed non-compliant and face restrictions; market uncertainty. Investment Sophisticated investors might seek out compliant and regulated altcoins; focus on projects with strong fundamentals and real-world use cases. Reduced retail investor interest in altcoins perceived as riskier; market volatility due to regulatory news; funding challenges for non-compliant projects. Innovation Incentive for altcoin projects to innovate within regulatory frameworks; development of compliance-focused technologies and protocols. Potential stifling of innovation if regulations are too restrictive; brain drain to more crypto-friendly jurisdictions; slower pace of development for some projects. For those invested in or developing altcoins, the key takeaway is to closely monitor the evolving regulatory landscape and prioritize compliance and transparency. Projects with strong fundamentals, real-world utility, and a proactive approach to regulation are likely to be best positioned to navigate this new era. Actionable Insights: Preparing for the Crypto Policy Shift So, what should you do to prepare for this potential crypto policy shift? Here are some actionable insights: Stay Informed: Follow reputable news sources and crypto analysts for real-time updates on the White House Crypto Summit and related policy announcements. Diversify Wisely: Consider diversifying your crypto portfolio, understanding the potential regulatory differences between Bitcoin and altcoins. Due Diligence is Key: For altcoin investments, conduct thorough research into the project’s fundamentals, team, technology, and compliance efforts. Engage in Dialogue: Participate in discussions and forums about crypto regulation to stay ahead of the curve and contribute to the shaping of responsible policies. Prepare for Volatility: Major policy announcements can trigger market volatility. Be prepared for potential price swings and manage your risk accordingly. The crypto world is on the cusp of potentially transformative changes. President Trump’s anticipated policy shift could usher in a new era of regulation, adoption, and strategic importance for digital currencies. Whether you’re a seasoned crypto investor, a curious observer, or a developer in the space, now is the time to pay close attention and prepare for the ripples that this announcement could send across the global landscape. title: CZ Zhao acknowledges Vitalik Buterin’s pivotal role in crypto’s evolution
body: CZ Zhao has thanked Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin for his vital contribution to the growth of the cryptocurrency industry in a post on X. The former Binance CEO made the comments in response to a post that highlighted some of the key people who had a say in making the crypto space grow. Zhao attributed Buterin to the wide scale of the blockchain industry. He relates to various things that the Ethereum co-founder helped develop, including the invention of smart contracts by Ethereum’s inception. Smart contracts are the lifeblood of the development of decentralized applications and platforms. Buterin drives crypto growth and revolutionizes digital ownership Buterin is also credited with devising another major standard, the ERC-20 token standard, which has enabled the launch of thousands of altcoins on the Ethereum network. The widespread and standardized use began a rapid cycle of growth for the crypto market and a framework for many blockchain projects. Buterin also played a key role in changing the way we think about digital ownership with the emergence of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), defining the ERC-721 standard. NFTs have grown into a major asset class in industries ranging from art and entertainment to gaming and digital identity. In his remarks, Zhao downplayed his own impact on the industry, humorously referring to himself as “a pleb still learning about blockchain.” Despite his modesty, CZ has been a key player in the crypto ecosystem, particularly through his leadership at Binance, which grew into one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges. CZ recalls meeting Buterin and questioning Ethereum’s potential Zhao also looked back at his first encounters with Buterin. He said he’d first met the Ethereum co-founder at a Bitcoin conference in 2013, a year before the launch of Ethereum’s initial coin offering (ICO) in 2014. At that time, Zhao had not been convinced Ethereum’s language was Turing complete, and he asked Buterin whether it was “too big of a bite to chew.” Buterin reassured Zhao that the vision was attainable. While CZ confessed that he wished he had bought more Ethereum during its ICO, he theorized that missing out may have motivated him to build Binance and the Binance Coin (BNB) ecosystem. Zhao’s nod to Buterin highlights the Ethereum co-creator’s impact on the advancement of blockchain. With the crypto space ever-evolving, influencers like Buterin and Zhao help shape this systemic industry’s trajectory through their contributions and innovations. CZ urges traders to cut investments amid crypto crash CZ recently gained significant attention amid a crypto market crash with his investment tip. He posted on X, addressing the current market dip whilst urging traders to reduce investment portfolios if stressed. Notably, cryptocurrency prices were facing immense heat, as Bitcoin (BTC) hit a $78K low, while altcoins mimicked an even harder price fall. As per CZ’s X post last week, he advised traders and investors who were stressed amid the current dip to reduce their ‘investment size, given one considers crypto as an investment.’ The Binance founder stated, “Dips are a part of free markets,” further rationalizing the current market crash. CZ recently said he will not build any new crypto projects. The decision comes as a significant shift for the influential figure who once defied skeptics and built Binance into the world’s leading crypto exchange. He recently tweeted about the importance of innovation, telling developers to “keep building.” But when asked if he was starting a new exchange or project, he noted , “I won’t start a new project. I will help other founders.” Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? Learn how to do it with DeFi in our upcoming webclass. Save Your Spot
